data.title: Fun Snack on King Street
data.text:
Fun place for tea, coffee and a snack, we ate outside and enjoyed the weather and people walking by. 

Good onion soup, good pastries, and good bread.

data.title: Saturday brunch
data.text: We had the all-inclusive brunch which included an entreé, a basket of pastries, juice and coffee. That was $16, which is a great price for brunch. The food was plentiful but in terms of flavor it was just okay. There was nothing memorable about it and the service was so-so. It is by no means a bad breakfast option, just a forgettable one.

data.title: Not so good these days
data.text: This used to be a great little bakery and place to grab a quick bite but a recent visit took it off my list.  The brioche for the sandwich was very dry and did not appear to have been baked that day.  In addition the display case, the last several times I have been in to buy baked goods, looks a bit tired and as though the baked goods were not freshly baked.  There don't seem to be many customers these days and it is, unfortunately, not surprising given the reduction in quality of its products.

data.title: Unique and delicious
data.text: My wife and I absolutely enjoyed this stop. My wife had the turkey hash and I had the berry French toast. The food was as close to perfect as it could be and the service was great. We highly recommend a visit to support this local business.

data.title: Good little stop
data.text: This is a restaurant on King St, Alexandria VA, that serves breakfast and lunch. They also have muffins, pastries, and cakes that you can buy to- go. I had a blueberry muffin, which was fresh and had a fair amount of blueberries. It was good but nothing out of the ordinary. My wife got a ham & cheese pancake wrap, which she thoroughly enjoyed. There was a lot of both ham and cheese in each of the three cakes she got. The service was good and the price was fair for what we got.

data.title: Daddy Daughter Date
data.text:
While the family was vacationing near DC, my wife and her dad went off to see the sights, so my daughter (2 1/2 years old) and I went out to take a stroll and get a bite to eat. I figured based on the name that this place would be a hit.

The inside is quaint. It's not much more than a coffee shop-type setting, but that's not necessarily a bad thing. Neither of us was looking for anything huge for dinner. I spotted the French onion soup, and Lucy espied a cupcake that she liked. Our food and drink came out in short order. The waitress was friendly. I liked the soup a lot. Lucy was lukewarm on the cupcake, so I tasted it. It was a little dry, but overall good.

Not a lot of places are easy for a dad to bring his 2-year-old daughter to, but this one was. If you're in the mood for a quick snack or a light dinner, give it a shot.

data.title: My favorite place for Brunch
data.text:
I visited the place recently, after a few years away.
Food was as always delicious. Service was great. Always a good option for brunch.

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: Good location on King St looked promising. Server very pleasant but food let them down. Mums blueberry scone was dry and could've done with warming through. My tuna sandwich was more bread than anything else and almost a bag of leaves for garnish was ott.

data.title: Great breakfast
data.text: Stopped here for breakfast on our last visit in early March and loved it. Service was great as was the food which was more than we could eat. Prices were not cheap but were fair for the quality of the food. Thanks!

data.title: Breakfast
data.text: The breakfast place was average.  I got the BIG breakfast and french toast to go along with it. After we finished our meal, the waitress came over and said they only were taking cash at the moment.  That was an inconvenience since we didn't have it and the waitress should of said they were taking cash only before we placed our order.  However, they state that do except all credit cards etc.  A little shady!!!!

data.title: Good food at a good price
data.text: The service was fast, friendly, and helpful. My wife had the spinach and goat cheese omelette, my daughter had the apple and cinnamon French toast while I had the eggs Benedict. They were all delicious. The atmosphere is comfortable and relaxed. It is a good way to start the day.

data.title: Great for a quick " home made " lunch
data.text:
Great service.we were walking on the side walk trying to decide where to eat lunch and a very friendly gentleman invited us to all come in for lunch.
Very home style cooking , like a small diner/ bakery.
The soup ( beef / barley) was delicious.
The tuna fish salad sandwich was great.
Everyone enjoyed their lunch.  Fast service. 
Very glad that we stopped in this small cafeteria/bakery / restaurant.
Food was delicious and fresh .

data.title: Great little breakfast spot
data.text: Bread and chocolate is a great little breakfast but I'll finish French pastries very tasty croissants the chocolate croissants are excellent Coffee is rich and full bodies

data.title: Great for breakfast or brunch
data.text: Swiss style crepes are delicious. Excellent coffee. Service can be a bit hurried as it does get bust.

data.title: Breakfast visit
data.text: Recently visited this location on an early Sunday morning. We chose this place as not many breakfast places in Old Town seem to be open before 9 am. The service was very good, perhaps because we were one of two tables at that time. The food was rather flavorless. We had the egg frutatta and the big breakfast. Very underwhelmimg. The coffee, though, was excellent.

data.title: Yum Plus
data.text: Stopped in for breakfast.  OJ fresh squeezed.  Coffee hot.  Breakfast and pastries were fresh and really good.  Don't think you could go wrong with anything on the menu. Servers have worked there forever and are happy to help, just ask!

data.title: Enticing name...disappointing food and service
data.text:
In short, there are too many better options within a stone's throw, so keep walking and save yourself from mediocre food, pushy service and ill-equipped facilities.
However, if you decide to stop in anyway because you just can't resist the allure of the name, do not order the samosas or the falafel on light fares menu.

data.title: Usually good
data.text: We've gone here for brunch a few times.  It's usually good -- decent food, decent service -- but we've sometimes been less than pleased.  I'd definitely pick up pastries to go, but have been trying other brunch places.

data.title: Lovely cafe
data.text:
I admit that I sought out Bread & Chocolate for its free Wi-Fi.  I was very pleased to find out they served light lunches.

I sat at the bar and ordered their Classic French Onion soup and the California Croissant sandwich.  It wound up being a bit too much food.

The French Onion soup was quite good.  It had a lot of cheese and it came with a piece of toasted bread.  The broth looked different from other French Onion soups I've had before.  It was lighter, but it did not detract from the taste.  The California Croissant was tasty and came with a side salad.

The interior was cute and reminded me a wee bit of a French cafe/bistro.  I did walk by the display of yummy desserts.  Didn't partake this time, though.  

This place reminded me of Finale in Boston, MA.  A light lunch menu with scrumptious desserts.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: We stopped here, well, because of the name. We were very happy. Just wish I had room to eat more. Service was fast and friendly.
